history.text: Have you ever seen a Toro Film?
I have. This one here is listed as a fantasy, drama. Based on the information given would you agree?
yes, what about you?
I would. It also recieves a 92% from Rotten Tomatoes. That definitely peaks my interest
The film is very similar to del toros other films as well.
It states in the critical response that it is one of his most stunning. Based off of what I have seen from him that is really saying something!
yeah, and set in an earlier era. very interesting
Yea I see it is set in 1962. I really enjoy the aesthetics of the era. To set it in a high-security government facility is pretty adventurous.
Must have taken a lot of work on set
creative, and feeds into our fears about the government
Yes and a mute working in the labratory, how perfect. No one to tell her secrets too! In a sense.

true, It's set in the cold war as well, where secrets were very important
.
It shows that Zelda is played by Octavia Spencer. I really enjoy her acting. Who would your favorite actor/actress be as listed here?
I don't know any of them, except for the director and shannon so I can't say
Would you say this film is similar to his others?
She is a very good actress. So a humanoid amphibian...ever seen anything like described here? Makes me curious to see this movie. I would say from the description the movie sounds different
So not only does she bond with this creature, Elisa keeps it in her bathtub!
That's odd but that's typical of his films
The scratch that miraculously healed, wonder what that's about?
That's interesting.Maybe it has to do with the government experiements
What do you think of corrupt military and governments in the movie?

Possibly. But it doesn't state anything about the government being corrupt. I do think the situation is interesting. 
 Also in the Critical Response, I read Sally Hawkins character, Elisa is "mentally handicapped". To bond with a creature and get it out of that lab she has to be smart. I disagree.
I agree, but in those times many people were considered handicapped in some way.
the mute, is an orphan and it seems like del toro features similar characters in his works
Ah you make a good point there. I guess back then she would be considered handicapped.
the creature isn't so nice either, eating cats
Well yes and no. Not really nice but I mean what else was it gonna eat. I assume no on ereally knows its diet. It kinda sounds funny in a way
true, we don't really know much about the creature
the movie is going to be annoying with so much sign language though
I know for some it may be but I don't mind it so much. I am learning with my child to be proficient in ASL. Definitely an acquired taste, however.
The creature begins to get sick. I wonder if that is because he is out of his home enviornment. So many unanswered questions!
Oh, I see. Overall, it's an interesting movie and it's been interesting chatting. Regards
